title: The Royal Australian Army Nursing Corps
creator_credit: Australia. Army. Directorate of Public Relations
brief_description: Deals with training and work of women who choose army nursing as a career. Recruits take six weeks basic training with the Women’s Royal Australian Army Corps at Queenscliff and afterwards complete their course at the School of Army Health at Healesville. Shows living conditions, sports and recreational facilities.
